papers.title: Experimental study of $^{53}\mathrm{Cr}$ via the ($d,pγ$) reaction
papers.summary: Author(s): M. Spieker et al.Excited states in $^{53}\mathrm{Cr}$ were studied via the $^{52}\mathrm{Cr}(d,pγ)$ reaction up to the neutron-separation threshold. papers.title: Low-mass vector-meson production at forward rapidity in $p+p$ and $\mathrm{Au}+\mathrm{Au}$ collisions at $\sqrt{{s}_{{}_{NN}}}=200$ GeV

papers.title: Reconstructing jet azimuthal anisotropies with cumulants
papers.authors: Tanner Mengel, Niseem Magdy, Ron Belmont, Anthony Timmins, and Christine Nattrass
papers.summary: Author(s): Tanner Mengel, Niseem Magdy, Ron Belmont, Anthony Timmins, and Christine NattrassIn relativistic heavy-ion collisions, where quark-gluon plasma forms, hadron production is anisotropic at both low and high transverse momentum, driven by flow dynamics and spatial anisotropies. To better understand these mechanisms, we use multiparticle correlations to reconstruct jet anisotropies.…[Phys. Rev. C 112, 064919] Published Fri Dec 26, 2025

papers.summary: Author(s): N. V. Kolomoyets, O. V. Teryaev, and V. VoronyukThe evolution of the “microscopic” Hubble parameter related to the expansion of matter born in heavy-ion collisions was obtained for nucleons and pions. papers.title: Impact of spin polarization on transport and thermodynamic coefficients
